techmeme.title: Elon Musk is using the same tactics he used during his Twitter takeover at DOGE, including offering exits to federal employees and testing engineering prowess (New York Times)
Google announces a "voluntary exit program" for employees working in the Platforms & Devices group in the US, which includes Android, Chrome, Pixel, and more (Abner Li/9to5Google)
Sources: Satya Nadella and Microsoft execs moved quickly to get engineers to test and deploy R1 on Azure and GitHub in 10 days, an unusually fast turnaround (Tom Warren/The Verge)
DataBank, which provides high-performance compute-ready data centers for enterprise clients, raised $250M from PE firm TJC and $600M in a secondary share offer (Kyle Wiggers/TechCrunch)
Sources: bankers trying to offload ~$3B in X debt claim X had $1.2B in adjusted EBITDA in 2024, roughly flat from before Elon Musk's buyout, a sign of recovery (Bloomberg)
